content:
on to conclude that abortion after rape is not wrong either.
Responses to Thomson’s argument have largely turned on emphasizing
the differences between the two situations. Many critics claim that Thom-
son’s argument fails because abortion involves killing, whereas unplugging
does not. If you stay plugged to the violinist, this will save the violinist, so
to unplug yourself is to fail to save the violinist. But critics deny that to un-
plug yourself from the violinist is the same as to killthe v
